name: Old Lady Dithers
descriptions: T. "Old Lady" Dithers is one of the inhabitants of Vault 112 and part of the Tranquility Lane virtual reality simulation in 2277.

Old Lady Dithers is a inhabitant of Vault 112 and, like the other Vault Dwellers, is trapped in the Tranquility Lane simulation and subject to Stanislaus Braun's whims. Unlike the others, she is aware of what Braun is doing and tries to alert the others, who are dismissive of her. The terminal attached to her Tranquility lounger in Vault 112 notes that several readouts show anomalous readings as follows:

topics.response_text: You shouldn't be here, little one.

topics.topic_text: Get away from me, you crazy old bat.
topics.response_text: You're the only one who can end it. You must end it, don't you see? You're the only one who can disable the Failsafe!

topics.topic_text: Finally, someone who knows what's going on! How do I get out of here?
topics.response_text: We're not really here. We're not really talking. It's all made-up, make-believe. We're sleeping, dreaming.

topics.topic_text: What are you talking about? You're not making any sense.
topics.response_text: This. All this, it's all fake! Made-up, a dream world. Only the dream never ends. I want it to end, for all our sakes.

topics.topic_text: I'm serious. Get the hell away from me.
topics.response_text: You need to know the truth, otherwise he'll suck you in just like all the others. Beware!

topics.topic_text: You're crazy. Get away from me.
topics.response_text: You can't fool me. You know I'm right... You know none of this is real.

topics.topic_text: What Failsafe? What the hell are you talking about?
topics.response_text: It's in the abandoned house. He doesn't want us going in there, because he's afraid we might find it.
He calls himself Betty now, but he's still the same. He can put on a new face all he likes, but underneath he's still evil.{full of contempt; very intense, slightly crazy}

topics.topic_text: How come you're the only one who seems to know this?
topics.response_text: Don't know. Can't sleep sometimes... Hear voices... My own skin doesn't feel right. None of this is right. You've got to believe me!

topics.topic_text: Just leave me alone. I'm busy.
topics.response_text: I'm telling you, this can all end if you find it...

topics.topic_text: Where did you say the Failsafe was?
topics.response_text: The abandoned house. Keeps that one to himself, he does. That's where it is. That's why he doesn't want us in there.

topics.topic_text: Sure, sure. I'm working on it. Really.
topics.response_text: You have to find it. It's the only way any of us can truly rest...

topics.topic_text: Um... I went into the abandoned house, but I didn't see anything.
topics.response_text: Did you look? Did you really look? You can't just look with your eyes, you know.

topics.topic_text: There's nothing in that house. You're lying, or crazy, or both.
topics.response_text: It's there, I tell you! He hides it, like he hides himself. You've got to find a way to draw it out. He knows how to do it, but he'd never tell you.
Oh he's here, you can be sure of that. Just don't expect to see what you're used to seeing.

topics.topic_text: Can you tell me anything about the Rockwells' marriage?
topics.response_text: Another of his games? I won't be a party to it. You leave those poor people be.

topics.topic_text: What can you tell me about Timmy Neusbaum?
topics.response_text: Not really a boy, is he? Got him all confused, looking like he does.

conversation.response_text: Betty... It's him. I know. He knows I know.
